latest news.eng_title: Three-Day Solar and Geomagnetic Activity Forecast: What to Expect
latest news.summary: According to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's (NOAA) Space Weather Prediction Center, a geomagnetic storm with a K-index of 4 (yellow level) is expected on Monday, August 19. This corresponds to a small magnetic storm that will subside by the end of the day. On Tuesday and Wednesday, August 20 and 21, a K-index of 3 (green level) is forecasted, indicating small magnetic waves. It is worth noting that the forecast may change as researchers update their data every three hours.
latest news.title: Магнітні бурі, прогноз на три дні: чого очікувати від сонячної активності 19-21 серпня

latest news.eng_title: Solar and Geomagnetic Activity Forecast for August 19-21, 2024
latest news.summary: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Center for Space Weather Prediction has released a forecast for solar and geomagnetic activity from August 19 to 21, 2024. According to the forecast, a small geomagnetic storm with a K-index of 4 (yellow level) is expected on Monday, August 19, which will subside by the end of the day. On Tuesday and Wednesday, August 20 and 21, a K-index of 3 (green level) is expected, indicating small magnetic disturbances. However, the forecast is subject to change as solar activity researchers update their data every three hours.
latest news.title: Магнитные бури, прогноз на три дня: чего ожидать от солнечной активности 19-21 августа

latest news.eng_title: Magnetic Storm Forecast for the Week of August 19: Will There Be New Disturbances in the Magnetosphere?
latest news.summary: A powerful magnetic storm occurred over the weekend, causing polar lights to appear in the sky. However, according to experts from the laboratory of solar astronomy at the Space Research Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences, there will be no significant disturbances in the Earth's magnetic field this week. The Kp-index, which measures the strength of disturbances, is expected to reach three points on August 19, two points on August 20 and 21, and three points on August 22 and 23. The weekend of August 24 and 25 is expected to be calm, with the Kp-index not exceeding two points. However, the forecast may change at any moment, as the Sun is currently at its peak of activity and may surprise us with new solar flares, plasma ejections, and magnetic storms. 'We recommend following us in Telegram and Viber for the latest and most up-to-date information,' the article notes.
latest news.title: Прогноз магнитных бурь на неделю с 19 августа: стоит ли ожидать новых возмущений в магнитосфере

latest news.eng_title: Solar Activity Forecast for August 19-21: Low Magnetic Storms Expected
latest news.summary: According to the SWPC NOAA, the solar activity is expected to be low on August 19-21. On August 19, the K-index is expected to be 4 (yellow level), indicating weak magnetic storms. On August 20 and 21, the K-index is expected to be 2 (green level), indicating low geomagnetic disturbances. It is essential to note that the forecasts of magnetic storms can change as researchers update their data every three hours. The article explains that magnetic storms are caused by regular solar flares and explosions, which release a significant amount of solar energy. The article also provides information on how to help the body during magnetic storms, such as maintaining a regular routine, avoiding strong foods and drinks, and engaging in physical activities.
latest news.title: Прогноз магнітних бур на 19-21 серпня: якою буде сонячна активність

latest news.summary: A geomagnetic storm is expected on August 19, 2024, with a force of around 3 points. According to the Solar Astronomy Laboratory of the Russian Academy of Sciences, the probability of a magnetic storm in the next 24 hours is 25%, and the risk of a strong geomagnetic storm is around 15%. The force of the geomagnetic storm will be 3 points from 6 am to 12 pm, and then it will not exceed 2 points until the end of the day. While powerful magnetic disturbances are not expected, meteorologists will get a small break. It's time to focus on their health. Strengthening the immune system and a healthy lifestyle will help prepare for new solar attacks expected at the end of the month, as said by the authors.
latest news.title: Магнитная буря 19 августа 2024 года: сила геоударов составит около 3 баллов

latest news.eng_title: Earth's Magnetic Field Returns to Calm State After Magnetic Storm
latest news.summary: According to Sergey Bogachyov, head of the solar astronomy laboratory at the Space Research Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences, a magnetic storm occurred on Sunday morning. 'The storm was on Saturday night to Sunday morning. Its level was measured as 3 on a 6-point scale. It was a strong event, but not a record one. The disturbances were not very long-lasting - several hours. The event ended around 02:00 MSK. Currently, the Earth's magnetic field is in a calm state,' he said. The storm was previously reported by Mikhail Leus, leading specialist at the 'Fobos' weather center, who stated that it would last until midday on Sunday.
latest news.title: В ИКИ РАН заявили о спокойном состоянии магнитного поля Земли

latest news.eng_title: Geomagnetic storm begins on Earth — expert
latest news.summary: A G3-class geomagnetic storm has begun on Earth, according to Mikhail Leus, a leading expert at the Fobos weather center. The storm started on Saturday evening and is expected to continue until Sunday noon, with its severity fluctuating from strong to weak. Leus noted that the disturbances in the geomagnetic field intensified, reaching the G3 class at 8:46 p.m. Moscow time. As he wrote on his Telegram channel, 'A geomagnetic storm began on the Earth on Saturday evening. After 6:00 p.m. [Moscow time, 3:00 p.m. GMT] it was consistent with the moderate G1 magnetic storm. Disturbances in the geomagnetic field continued to intensify further, reaching the G3 class at 8:46 p.m. [Moscow time, 5:46 p.m. GMT]'
latest news.title: Geomagnetic storm begins on Earth — expert

latest news.eng_title: Rare, severe geomagnetic storm hits Earth: Will it impact the grid?
latest news.summary: A rare and severe geomagnetic storm hit Earth on Monday, reaching a G4 level in strength, classified as 'severe.' The storm may continue into the evening as solar flaring continues. According to Shawn Dahl, service coordinator at the Space Weather Prediction Center, 'Severe levels is pretty extraordinary. It's a very rare event to happen.' The storm may impact Earth's infrastructure, including the power grid, radio communications, and satellite operations. However, there shouldn't be major issues with ATMs, cell phones, or other technology people depend upon, unless power outages occur. The Space Weather Prediction Center activated a hotline to keep power grid operators informed on the latest space weather activity. While it's unlikely to see the northern lights due to the storm's expected decline, there is a slim chance of seeing the aurora in certain states, including Washington, Montana, North Dakota, and Minnesota. 'However, there is always uncertainty when it comes to space weather and just how long a CME passage may continue,' Dahl said. 'If that happens, Dahl says we could see G1 and G2 level storming into Monday night.'
latest news.title: Rare, severe geomagnetic storm hits Earth: Will it impact the grid?

news knowledge.summary: According to Leus, the geomagnetic field index Kp exceeded 6 units at 18:00 MSK, corresponding to a moderate geomagnetic storm of class G1. The geomagnetic disturbances then intensified, and by 20:46 MSK, the storm had reached a strong level of class G3. Leus predicted that the magnetic storms, with fluctuations in intensity from weak to strong, would last on Earth at least until noon on Sunday. A powerful geomagnetic storm had already engulfed the Earth earlier in the week, reaching a level of G4. Following a powerful solar flare on August 14, experts predicted a new magnetic storm. Geomagnetic disturbances are expected from late Saturday evening, August 17, to early Monday morning, August 19.
news knowledge.title: На Землю обрушилась сильная магнитная буря

news knowledge.summary: A strong geomagnetic storm of class G3 has hit the Earth and will last until Sunday afternoon, according to Mikhail Leus, a leading specialist at the 'Fobos' weather center. The storm began in the evening of August 17 and, as Leus noted, after 18:00 Moscow time, the geomagnetic field index Kp exceeded six units, corresponding to a moderate geomagnetic storm of class G1. 'The geomagnetic field disturbances continued to grow, and at 20:46 Moscow time, the geomagnetic storm became strong, class G3,' Leus wrote in his Telegram channel. The storm is a result of a new powerful solar flare that occurred on the Sun on August 14 and is directed towards the Earth.
news knowledge.title: На Земле разразилась сильная магнитная буря класса G3

news knowledge.eng_title: No Expected Magnetic Storms on Friday, August 16, 2024
news knowledge.summary: According to the Russian Laboratory of Solar Astronomy, there are no expected magnetic storms on Friday, August 16, 2024. The K-index, a measure of geomagnetic activity, is predicted to be between two and three, indicating a low level of geomagnetic activity. The probability of a magnetic storm is 5% and the probability of a strong magnetic storm is less than 1%. Even people who are not usually sensitive to weather may experience symptoms such as headaches, weakness, sleep problems, blood pressure fluctuations, and tachycardia. To alleviate these symptoms, doctors recommend drinking plenty of water, eating a balanced diet, limiting salt intake, getting enough rest, and spending time outdoors. Additionally, it is advised to avoid physical and emotional overexertion.
news knowledge.title: Будут ли магнитные бури сегодня, 16 августа 2024 года?

news knowledge.eng_title: Magnetic Storm Alert: 6-Ball Geomagnetic Disturbances Expected on August 13
news knowledge.summary: A magnetic storm of moderate intensity is expected to continue until the end of the day, with a Kp-index of 6. This will affect not only people sensitive to weather changes, but also ordinary citizens. By evening, the storm's intensity is expected to decrease to 4. According to the solar astronomy laboratory, the risk of a G1-class magnetic storm is 25%, while a strong magnetic storm is possible with a probability of 55%. The flare index is in the orange zone, with over 10 flares detected in the past day. During a magnetic storm, people may experience decreased well-being, reduced productivity, and headaches. Doctors recommend reducing workload, avoiding stress, and spending more time outdoors. People with chronic illnesses should not ignore their doctor's instructions.
news knowledge.title: Магнитная буря 13 августа 2024 года: на Земле зафиксировали 6-балльные геоудары

news knowledge.summary: A strong geomagnetic storm of level G3 has begun on Earth, according to the Institute of Applied Geophysics. The storm's index of disturbance has reached a level of G3, which is considered 'strong' on a five-level scale, where G1 is 'weak' and G5 is 'extremely strong'. The storm may cause disruptions to energy systems, including false alarms and overheating of oil transformers. Additionally, there may be interruptions in satellite navigation and low-frequency radio communication, as well as disruptions in high-frequency radio communication. In mid-latitudes, polar lights may be observed. This is not the first geomagnetic storm of the season, as two storms of class G2 occurred on August 10 and 11, according to KP.RU. 'The storm's peak occurred at midnight Moscow time and lasted for several hours,' said a source. 'We are monitoring the situation and will provide updates as necessary.'
news knowledge.title: На Земле началась сильная магнитная буря уровня G3

news knowledge.eng_title: Geomagnetic Storm Alert: 7-Ball Storm on August 12
news knowledge.summary: A strong geomagnetic storm began on the morning of August 12, with the Kp-index, indicating the level of disturbance, reaching 6 points. According to preliminary forecasts, the geomagnetic background will calm down only closer to midnight. However, the magnetosphere will again become excited during the day, with the Kp-index reaching 4 points. On August 14 and 15, the geomagnetic background will be calm, with a Kp-index of 3 points. On the weekends, August 16 and 17, a storm is not expected. However, it is not possible to rule out the possibility of changing the forecast due to increased solar activity and the appearance of new flares. 'It is worth noting that the forecast may change due to the high activity on the Sun and the emergence of new solar flares,' said the experts from the laboratory of solar astronomy of the IKI and ISZFRAN. 'We recommend following us in Telegram and Viber for the most up-to-date and timely information from KP-Izhsk.'
news knowledge.title: Прогноз магнитных бурь на неделю с 12 августа: неделя началась с 7-балльной магнитной бури

news knowledge.summary: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's (NOAA) Center for Space Weather Prediction has released a forecast for solar and geomagnetic activity on August 3-4, 2024. A geomagnetic storm is expected to continue on Saturday, August 3, and Sunday, August 4, with a K-index of 6 (red level), indicating a strong storm that can affect people and technology. According to the forecast, 'the storm is expected to have a significant impact on people with weather-related conditions.' It is noted that the forecast may change as researchers update their data every three hours.
news knowledge.title: Магнітні бурі: прогноз на вихідні, 3-4 серпня

news knowledge.eng_title: Magnetic Storm on August 2, 2024: Earth Experiences 6-Ball Geomagnetic Storms
news knowledge.summary: Residents of the region will experience sensitive fluctuations in the Earth's magnetic field on August 2, 2024, due to a moderate magnetic storm with a Kp-index of 6. According to meteorologists, the storm will be felt even by healthy people, and those with meteo-sensitivity may experience serious discomfort. The storm is expected to subside in the second half of the day, with the Kp-index dropping to 2. The laboratory of solar astronomy estimates the probability of a strong magnetic storm at 15% and the risk of a magnetic storm at 1%. The authors note that during such events, people often experience nausea, headaches, and exacerbation of chronic diseases. To mitigate these effects, doctors recommend avoiding physical exertion, reducing stress levels, and taking more breaks. Additionally, going for walks in fresh air can be beneficial. As one doctor might say, 'It is essential to prioritize your health during a magnetic storm.'
news knowledge.title: Магнитная буря 2 августа 2024 года: Земля испытает 6-балльные геоудары

news knowledge.eng_title: Magnetic Storm on July 23, 2024: Approach of the Strongest Storm of the Summer
news knowledge.summary: A powerful geomagnetic storm is expected to hit the Earth on July 24, 2024, with a K-index of 6, classified as a G2-level magnetic storm. This may cause headaches, high blood pressure, and insomnia in people who are sensitive to weather changes. Currently, the flare activity index is at an orange (medium) level, with 21 solar flares recorded, including 6 of magnitude M. No plasma bursts were detected overnight.
news knowledge.title: Магнитная буря 23 июля 2024 года: приближение мощнейшего шторма

news knowledge.eng_title: Geomagnetic Storm on June 21, 2024: Risk of Strong Solar Flares Reaches Maximum
news knowledge.summary: A geomagnetic storm is expected on June 21, 2024, with a 3-point KP-index, which is considered a moderate level. Although the effects on Earth will be minimal, the risk of solar flares has increased to 80% within a day. Two large solar regions have formed, which could lead to a powerful explosion. Scientists are unable to predict whether the explosion will occur or not. The flare index remains low, which is concerning, as it may indicate that energy is building up for a strong explosion. As a result, people may experience health problems, headaches, and decreased productivity. Doctors recommend spending more time outdoors, reducing stress, and avoiding strenuous physical activities and bad habits.
news knowledge.title: Магнитная буря 21 июня 2024 года: риск сильных вспышек на Солнце вырос до максимума
